turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Think she'll hold?

turns.speaker: CASY
turns.text: If she does it'll be a miracle outa Scripture.

turns.speaker: CASY
turns.text: I ain't no more a preacher, you know.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: We know. But ain't none of our folks ever been buried without a few words.

turns.speaker: CASY
turns.text: I'll say 'em--an' make it short.  This here ol' man jus' lived a life an' jus' died out of it. I don't know whether he was good or bad, an' it don't matter much. Heard a fella say a poem once, an' he says, "All that lives is holy." But I wouldn't pray for jus' a ol' man that's dead, because he's awright. If I was to pray I'd pray for the folks that's alive an' don't know which way to turn. Grampa here, he ain't got no more trouble like that. He's got his job all cut out for 'im--so cover 'im up and let 'im get to it.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: How about us? Is that the truth for us?

turns.speaker: CASY
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: CASY
turns.text: Gimme that gun. Now git outa here. Go down in them willows an' wait.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: I ain't gonna run.

turns.speaker: CASY
turns.text: He seen you, Tom! You wanta be fingerprinted? You wanta get sent back for breakin' parole?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: You're right!

turns.speaker: CASY
turns.text: Hide in the willows. If it's awright to come back I'll give you four high whistles.

turns.speaker: CASY
turns.text: What's the matter?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Casy! What you doin' here?

turns.speaker: CASY
turns.text: Well, if it ain't Tom Joad. How ya, boy?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Thought you was in jail.

turns.speaker: CASY
turns.text: No, I done my time an' got out. Come on in.

turns.speaker: CASY
turns.text: Lookie, Tom. We come to work here. They tell us it's gonna be fi' cents. But they was a whole lot of us, so the man says two an' a half cents. Well, a fella can't even eat on that, an' if he got kids...  So we says we won't take it. So they druv us off. Now they're payin' you five--but when they bust this strike ya think they'll pay five?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: I dunno. Payin' five now.

turns.speaker: CASY
turns.text: I don't expeck we can las' much longer-- some a the folks ain't et for two days. You goin' back tonight?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: I aim to.

turns.speaker: CASY
turns.text: Well--tell the folks inside how it is, Tom. Tell 'em they're starvin' us and stabbin' theirself in the back. An' as sure as God made little apples it's goin' back to two an' a half jus' as soon as they clear us out.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: I'll tell 'em. But I don't know how. Never seen so many guys with guns. Wouldn't even let us talk today.

turns.speaker: CASY
turns.text: Try an' tell 'em, Tom. They'll get two an' a half, jus' the minute we're gone. An' you know what that is? That's one ton a peaches picked an' carried for a dollar. That way you can't even buy food enough to keep you alive! Tell 'em to come out with us, Tom! Them peaches is *ripe*. Two days out an' they'll pay *all* of us five!

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: They won't. They're a-gettin' five an' they don't care about nothin' else.

turns.speaker: CASY
turns.text: But jus' the minute they ain't strike- breakin' they won't get no five!

turns.speaker: CASY
turns.text: I guess that's right. Have to take a beatin' before he'll know.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: We was outa food. Tonight we had meat. Not much, but we had it. Think Pa's gonna give up his meat on account a other fellas? An' Rosasharn needs milk. Think Ma's gonna starve that baby jus' cause a bunch a fellas is yellin' outside a gate?

turns.speaker: CASY
turns.text: Got to learn, like I'm a-learnin'. Don't know it right yet myself, but I'm tryin' to fin' out. That's why I can't ever be a preacher again. Preacher got to *know*.  I don't. I got to *ask*.

turns.speaker: CASY
turns.text: Can't tell if you hear it or not. You hear it, Tom?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: I hear it. I think they's some guys comin' this way, lots of 'em. We better get outa here.

turns.speaker: ROSASHARN
turns.text: Seems like we wasn't never gonna do nothin' but move. I'm so tar'd.

turns.speaker: CONNIE
turns.text: Women is always tar'd.

turns.speaker: ROSASHARN
turns.text: You ain't--you ain't sorry, are you, honey?

turns.speaker: CONNIE
turns.text: No, but--but you seen that advertisement in the Spicy Western Story magazine. Don't pay nothin'. Jus' send 'em the coupon an' you're a radio expert--nice clean work.

turns.speaker: ROSASHARN
turns.text: But we can still do it, honey.

turns.speaker: CONNIE
turns.text: I ought to done it then--an' not come on any trip like this.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: They shore don't waste no time!  Take her out.

turns.speaker: COP
turns.text: Save your strength, lady.  Get goin', buddy. No campin' here.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: We ain't campin'. We jus' stoppin' a minute--

turns.speaker: COP
turns.text: Lissen, I heard that before--

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Fella named Spencer sent us--said they was work pickin' peaches.

turns.speaker: COP
turns.text: Want to work, do you?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Sure do.

turns.speaker: COP
turns.text: Pull up behind that car.  Okay for this one. Take 'em through.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: What's the matter? What's happened?

turns.speaker: COP
turns.text: Little trouble up ahead, but you'll get through. Just follow the line.

turns.speaker: DAVIS
turns.text: I don't like nobody drawin' a bead on me.

turns.speaker: MULEY
turns.text: Then what are you doin' this kind a thing for--against your own people?

turns.speaker: DAVIS
turns.text: For three dollars a day, that's what I'm doin' it for. I got two little kids. I got a wife and my wife's mother. Them people got to eat. Fust and on'y thing I got to think about is my own folks. What happens to other folks is their lookout.

turns.speaker: MULEY
turns.text: But this is *my land*, son. Don't you understand?

turns.speaker: DAVIS
turns.text: *Used* to be your land. B'longs to the comp'ny now.

turns.speaker: MULEY
turns.text: Have it your own way, son, but just as sure as you touch my house with that cat I'm gonna blow you plumb to kingdom come.

turns.speaker: DAVIS
turns.text: You ain't gonna blow nobody nowhere. First place, you'd get hung and you know it. For another, it wouldn't be two days before they'd have another guy here to take my place.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: How about a lift, mister?

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: Can't you see that sticker?

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: Goin' far?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Just a few miles. I'd a walked her if my dogs wasn't pooped out.

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: Lookin' for a job?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: No, my old man got a place, forty acres. He's a sharecropper, but we been there a long time.

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: Oh!

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: Been doin' a job?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: I seen your hands. You been swinging a pick or a sledge--that shines up your hands. I notice little things like that all the time.  Got a trade?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Why don't you get to it, buddy?

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: Get to what?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: You know what I mean. You been givin' me a goin' over ever since I got in. Whyn't you go on and ask me where I been?

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: I don't stick my nose in nobody's business.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Naw--not much!

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: I stay in my own yard.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Listen. That big nose of yours been goin' over me like a sheep in a vegetable patch. But I ain't keepin' it a secret. I been in the penitentiary. Been there four years. Like to know anything else?

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: You ain't got to get sore.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Go ahead. Ask me anything you want.

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: I didn't mean nothing.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Me neither. I'm just tryin' to get along without shovin' anybody around, that's all.  See that road up ahead?

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: That's where I get off.

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: I never asked you!

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Sure, but you'd a throwed a fit if I hadn't tol' you.

turns.speaker: FIRST BOY
turns.text: You people got a lotta nerve.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: What you mean?

turns.speaker: FIRST BOY
turns.text: Crossin' the desert in a jalopy like this.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: You been acrost?

turns.speaker: FIRST BOY
turns.text: Sure, plenty, but not in no wreck like this.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: If we broke down maybe somebody'd give us a han'.

turns.speaker: FIRST BOY
turns.text: Well, maybe. But I'd hate to be doin' it. Takes more nerve than I got.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: It don't take no nerve to do somep'n when there ain't nothin' else you can do.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Workin'. Pickin' peaches. But I seen a bunch a fellas yellin' when we come in, so I come out to see what's goin' on. What's it all about?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: This here's a strike.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Well, fi' cents a box ain't much, but a fella can eat.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Fi' cents! They pain' you fi' cents?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Sure. We made a buck since midday.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: An' the nex' thing you know you'll be out, because they got it all figgered down to a T--until the harvest is in you're a *migrant* worker--afterwards, just a bum.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Five they're a-gettin' now, an' that's all they're int'rested in. I know exackly what Pa'd say. He'd jus' say it wasn't none a his business.

turns.speaker: GIRL
turns.text: What's he fixin' to do, ma?

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: Hush!

turns.speaker: GIRL
turns.text: I could break up some bresh if you want me, ma'am.

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: You want to get ast to eat, hunh?

turns.speaker: GIRL
turns.text: Yes, ma'am.

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: Didn' you have no breakfast?

turns.speaker: GIRL
turns.text: No, ma'am. They ain't no work hereabouts. Pa's in tryin' to sell some stuff to get gas so's we can get along.

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: Didn' none of these have no breakfast?

turns.speaker: PA
turns.text: What you mean you ain't goin'? We *got* to go. We got no place to stay.

turns.speaker: GRAMPA
turns.text: I ain't talkin' about you, I'm talkin' about me. And I'm a-stayin'. I give her a good goin' over all night long-- and I'm a-stayin'.

turns.speaker: PA
turns.text: But you can't *do* that, Grampa. This here land is goin' under the tractor. We *all* got to git out.

turns.speaker: GRAMPA
turns.text: All but me! I'm a-stayin'.

turns.speaker: PA
turns.text: Now listen, Grampa. Listen to me, just a minute.

turns.speaker: GRAMPA
turns.text: And I ain't gonna listen either. I tol' you what I'm gonna do.  And I don't give a hoot in a hollow if they's oranges and grapes crowdin' a fella outa bed even, I ain't a- goin' to California!  This here's my country. I b'long *here*.  It ain't no good--  --but it's mine.

turns.speaker: PA
turns.text: Easy, *easy!* You wanta bust his head wide open? Pull his arms, John.

turns.speaker: GRAMPA
turns.text: Ain't a-goin', thas all...

turns.speaker: PA
turns.text: Put somepin' over him, so he won't git sun-struck.  Ever'body set now?  Awright, Al, letta go!

turns.speaker: GRAMPA
turns.text: You know what I al'ays said: "Tom'll come bustin' outa that jail like a bull through a corral fence." Can't keep no Joad in jail!

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: I didn't bust out. They lemme out. Howya, Noah. Howya, Uncle John.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: What's the matter, Grampa?

turns.speaker: GRAMPA
turns.text: Ain't nothin' the matter. I just ain't a-goin', that's all.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: How 'bout Granma?

turns.speaker: GRAMPA
turns.text: Take her with you!

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Ma. Pa.  Grampa, his eyes hurt and hunted and frightened and bewildered, scratches in the dirt.

turns.speaker: GRAMPA
turns.text: And can't nobody *make* me go, either! Ain't nobody here *man* enough to make me! I'm a-stayin'.

turns.speaker: GRAMPA
turns.text: *Ain't* a-goin'... ain't a-goin'...

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: 'S all right, Grampa. You just kind a tar'd, that's all. Somebody fix a pallet.

turns.speaker: GUARD
turns.text: Where you going?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: California.

turns.speaker: GUARD
turns.text: How long you plan to be in Arizona?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: No longer'n we can get acrost her.

turns.speaker: GUARD
turns.text: Got any plants?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: No plants.

turns.speaker: GUARD
turns.text: Okay. Go ahead, but you better keep movin'.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Sure. We aim to.

turns.speaker: GUARD
turns.text: Where you think you're going?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Thought I'd take a walk. Any law against it?

turns.speaker: GUARD
turns.text: Well, you just turn around and walk the other way.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: You mean I can't even get outa here?

turns.speaker: GUARD
turns.text: Not tonight you can't. Want to walk back?--or you want me to whistle up some help and take you back?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: I'll walk back.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You take this.  I ain't hungry.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Whatta ya mean? You ain't et today.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I know, but I got a stomickache. I ain't hungry.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: You take that plate inside the tent an' you eat it.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Wouldn't be no use. I'd still see 'em inside the tent.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: You git. Go on now, git. You ain't doin' no good. They ain't enough for you.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I got to get a lot curiouser than I am--with all them cops out there.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Okay. I be back a little later.

turns.speaker: ROSASHARN
turns.text: Ma... all this, will it hurt the baby?

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: Now don't you go gettin' nimsy-mimsy.

turns.speaker: ROSASHARN
turns.text: Sometimes I'm all jumpy inside.

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: Well, can't nobody get through nine *months* without sorrow.

turns.speaker: ROSASHARN
turns.text: But will it--hurt the baby?

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: They use' to be a sayin': A chile born outa sorrow'll be a happy chile. An' another: Born outa too much joy'll be a doleful boy. That's the way I always heard it.

turns.speaker: ROSASHARN
turns.text: You don't ever get scairt, do you, Ma?

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: Sometimes. A little. Only it ain't scairt so much. It's just waitin' an' wonderin'. But when sump'n happens that I got to do sump'n--  --I'll do it.

turns.speaker: ROSASHARN
turns.text: Don't it ever scare you it won't be nice in California like we think?

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: No. No, it don't. I can't do that. I can't let m'self. All I can do is see how soon they gonna wanta eat again. They'd all get upset if I done anymore 'n that. They all depen' on me jus' thinkin' about that.  That's my part--that an' keepin' the fambly together.

turns.speaker: ROSASHARN
turns.text: Maybe Connie went to get some books to study up with. He's gonna be a radio expert, ya know. Maybe he figgered to suprise us.

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: Maybe that's jus' what he done.

turns.speaker: ROSASHARN
turns.text: We gonna live here?

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: Why, sure. It won't be so bad once we get her washed out.

turns.speaker: ROSASHARN
turns.text: I like the tent better.

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: This got a floor. Wouldn't leak when it rains.

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: Anybody ask anything?

turns.speaker: ROSASHARN
turns.text: No'm.

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: Stand by the door.

turns.speaker: ROSASHARN
turns.text: Ma... you know, if Connie was here I wouldn't min' any a this.

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: I know, honey, an' just as soon as we get settled Al's gonna set out an' look for him. How 'bout gas, Tommy?

turns.speaker: ROSASHARN
turns.text: Ma...  Ma, I--I can't go to the dance. I jus' can't Ma. I can't hardly stan' it, with Connie not here--an' me this way.

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: Why, honey, it makes folks happy to see a girl that way--makes folks sort of giggly an' happy.

turns.speaker: ROSASHARN
turns.text: I can't he'p it, Ma. It don't make *me* giggly an' happy.

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: You an' me's goin' together--jus' you an' me. We're a-goin' to that dance an' we're a-goin' to jus' set an' watch. If anybody says to come dance--why I'll say you're poorly. But you an' me, we're gonna hear the music an' see the fun.

turns.speaker: ROSASHARN
turns.text: An' you won't let nobody touch me?

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: No--an' look what I got for you.

turns.speaker: PA
turns.text: How 'bout it?

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: Go get Tom an' Al.  I dunno what to do. I got to feed the fambly. What'm I gonna do with these here?

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: You don't know *no* girls around here. You're lyin', *You're runnin' away*!

turns.speaker: PA
turns.text: Cut it out, Ma, or I'll--

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: You'll *what*?... Come on, Pa. Come on an' whup me. Jus' try it.

turns.speaker: PA
turns.text: Now don't get sassy, Ma.

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: Al ain't a-goin' away, an' you gonna *tell* him he ain't a-goin' away.  An' if you think diff'unt, you gotta whup me first. So some on.

turns.speaker: PA
turns.text: I never *seen* her so sassy.  An' she ain't so young, neither!

turns.speaker: PA
turns.text: Jus' sassy, that's all.

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: Sassy my foot! I'm jus' sick and tar'd a my folks tryin' to bust up. All we got lef' in the *worl'* is the fambly--an' right down at bottom that's all we *got* to have! Ef some of us dies, we can't he'p that--but ain't nobody else runnin' away!

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: Connie's gone.  Lit out this e'enin'--said he didn't know it was gonna be like this.

turns.speaker: PA
turns.text: Glad to get shet of him. Never was no good an' never will be--

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: Pa! Shh!

turns.speaker: PA
turns.text: How come I got to shh? Run out, didn't he?

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: Sump'n got to happen soon. We got one day's more grease, two day's flour, an' ten potatoes. After that...  An' Rosasharn, we got to remember she's gonna be due soon.

turns.speaker: PA
turns.text: It sure is hell jus' tryin' to get enough to eat.

turns.speaker: PA
turns.text: That!

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: They charge extry at the comp'ny store but they ain't no other place.

turns.speaker: PA
turns.text: Know where we're a-goin'?

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: Don't matter. Just got to go--an' keep a-goin', till we get plenty a distance away from here.

turns.speaker: PA
turns.text: Make her easy, John. Watch her.

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: She'll be awright.

turns.speaker: PA
turns.text: Maybe, but we shore takin' a beatin'.

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: I know. Maybe that makes us tough. Rich fellas come up an' they die, an' their kids ain't no good, an' they die out. But we keep a-comin'. We're the people that live. Can't nobody wipe us out. Can't nobody lick us. We'll go on forever, Pa. We're the people.

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: Thank God. Oh thank God.  Tommy, you didn't *bust* out, didya? You ain't got to hide, have you?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: No, Ma. I'm paroled. I got my papers.

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: I was so scared we was goin' away without you--and we'd never see each other again.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: I'd a found you, Ma.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Muley tol' me what happened, Ma. Are we goin' to California true?

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: We *got* to, Tommy. But that's gonna be awright. I seen the han'bills, about how much work they is, an' high wages, too. But I gotta fin' out somepin' else first, Tommy.  Did they hurt you, son? Did they hurt you an' make you mean-mad?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Mad, Ma?

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: Sometimes they do.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: No, Ma I was at first--but not no more.

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: Sometimes they do somethin' to you, Tommy. They hurt you--and you get mad--and then you get mean--and they hurt you again--and you get meaner, and meaner--till you ain't no boy or no man any more, but just a walkin' chunk a mean-mad. Did they hurt you like that, Tommy?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: No, Ma. You don't have to worry about that.

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: Thank God. I--I don't want no mean son

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: How about it, Ma?

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: I'm ready.

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: Wait. There's a half a bottle a soothin' sirup here.  It put the chillun to sleep.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Don't taste bad.

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: And they's some coffee here. I could fix him a cup...

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: That's right. And douse some in it.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Yes'm, that was it.

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: Your pa tol' me you didn't ought to cross it if you're paroled. Says they'll send you up again.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Forget it, Ma. I got her figgered out. Long as I keep outa trouble, ain't nobody gonna say a thing. All I gotta do is keep my nose clean.

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: Maybe they got crimes in California we don't know about. Crimes we don't even know *is* crimes.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Forget it, Ma. Jus' think about the nice things out there. Think about them grapes and oranges--an' ever'body got work--

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Ma, you sick?

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: Ya say we're acrost?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Look, Ma!

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: Thank God!  An' we're still together-- most of us.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Didn' you get no sleep?

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Was Granma bad?

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: Granma's dead.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: When?

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: Since before they stopped us las' night.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: An' that's why you didn't want 'em to look?

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: I was afraid they'd stop us an' wouldn't let us cross. But I tol' Granma. I tol' her when she was dyin'. I tol' her the fambly had ta get acrost. I tol' her we couldn't take no chances on bein' stopped.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: She shore don't look prosperous. Want to go somewheres else?

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: On a gallon a gas?  Let's set up the tent. Maybe I can fix us up some stew.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Ma, they comes a time when a man gets mad.

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: Tom--you tol' me--you promised you wasn't like that. You promised me.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: I know, Ma. I'm a tryin'. If it was the law they was workin' with, we could take it. But it *ain't* the law. They're workin' away at our spirits. They're tryin' to make us cringe an' crawl. They're workin' on our decency.

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: You promised, Tommy.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: I'm a-tryin', Ma. Honest I am.

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: You gotta keep clear, Tom. The fambly's breakin' up. You *got* to keep clear.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: What's that--detour?

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: Fust thing I'll get is coffee, cause ever'body been wantin' that, an' then some flour an' bakin' powder an' meat. Better not get no side- meat right off. Save that for later. Maybe Sat'dy. Got to get some soap too. An' milk. Rosasharn's got to have some milk.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Get some sugar too, for the coffee.

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: You know, I jus' can't remember when I felt so good before!

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Got any more, Ma?

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: No. That's all. You made a dollar, an' that's a dollar's worth.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: I ain't full.

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: Well, tomorra you'll get in a full day--full day's pay--an' we'll have plenty.

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: You be careful, Tommy. Don't you be stickin' your nose in anything.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Okay, Ma. Don't you worry.

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: How's it feel, Tommy?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Busted my cheek but I can still see. What'd you hear?

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: Looks like you done it.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: I kinda thought so. Felt like it.

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: Folks ain't talkin' about much else. They say they got posses out. Talkin' about a lynchin'--when they catch the fella.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: They killed Casy first.

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: That ain't the way they're tellin' it. They're sayin' you done it fust.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: They know what--this fella looks like?

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: They know he got hit in the face.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: I'm sorry, Ma. But--I didn't know what I was doin', no more'n when you take a breath. I didn't even know I was gonna do it.

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: It's awright, Tommy. I wisht you didn't do it, but you done what you had to do. I can't read no fault in you.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: I'm gonna go away tonight. I can't go puttin' this on you folks.

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: Tom! They's a whole lot I don't understan', but goin' away ain't gonna ease us.  They was the time when we was on the lan'. They was a bound'ry to us then. Ol' folks died off, an' little fellas come, an' we was always one thing-- we was the fambly--kinda whole an' clear. But now we ain't clear no more. They ain't nothin' keeps us clear. Al--he's a-hankerin' an' a- jibbitin' to go off on his own. An' Uncle John is just a-draggin' along. Pa's lost his place--he ain't the head no more. We're crackin' up, Tom. They ain't no fambly now. Rosasharn--  --she gonna have her baby, but *it* ain't gonna have no fambly. I been tryin' to keep her goin' but--Winfiel'-- what's he gonna be, this-a-way? Growin' up wild, an' Ruthie, too-- like animals. Got nothin' to trus'. Don't go Tom. Stay an' help. Help me.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Okay, Ma. I shouldn't, though. I know I shouldn't. But okay.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: That Casy. He might a been a preacher, but--he seen a lot a things clear. He was like a lantern--he helped mw see things too.

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: Comes night we'll get outa here.

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: It's jus' till we get some distance. Then you can come out.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: I'd hate to get *trapped* in here.

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Don't know--but it's better'n this.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: She's gettin' prettier, Ma.

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: Girl with a baby *always* gets prettier.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: They was some cops here, Ma. They was takin' down the license numbers. It looks like somebody knows sump'n.

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: It had to come, I reckon, soon or later.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: I'd like to stay. I'd like to be with ya--  --an' see your face when you an' Pa get settled in a nice little place. I sure wish I could see you then. But--  --I guess I won't never be able to do that. Not now.

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: I could hide you, Tommy.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: I know you would, Ma. But I ain't gonna let you. You hide somebody that's kilt a man an'... an' you'd be in trouble too.

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: Awright, Tommy. What you figger you gonna do?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: You know what I been thinkin' about, Ma? About Casy. About what he said, what he done, an' about how he died. An' I remember all of it.

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: He was a good man.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: I been thinkin' about us, too--about our people livin' like pigs, an' good rich lan' layin' fallow, or maybe one fella with a million acres, while a hundred thousan' farmers is starvin'. An' I been wonderin' if all our folks got together an' yelled--

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: Tommy, they'll drive you, an' cut you down like they done to Casy.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: They gonna drive me anyways. Soon or later they'll get me, for one thing if not another. Until then...

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: You don't aim to kill nobody, Tom!

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: No, Ma. Not that. That ain't it. But long as I'm a outlaw, anyways, maybe I can do sump'n. Maybe I can jus' fin' out sump'n. Jus' scrounge aroun' an' try to fin' out what it is that's wrong, an then see if they ain't sump'n could be done about it.  But I ain't thought it out clear, Ma. I can't. I don't know enough.

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: How'm I gonna know 'bout you? They might kill you an' I wouldn't know. They might hurt you. How'm I gonna know?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Well, maybe it's like Casy says, a fella ain't got a soul of his own, but on'y a piece of a big soul--the one big soul that belongs to ever'body-- an' then...

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: Then what, Tom?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Then it don't matter. Then I'll be all aroun' in the dark. I'll be ever'where--wherever you look. Wherever there's a fight so hungry people can eat, I'll be there. Wherever there's a cop beatin' up a guy, I'll be there. I'll be in the way guys yell when they're mad--an' I'll be in the way kids laugh when they're hungry an' they know supper's ready. An' when our people eat the stuff they raise, an' live in the houses they build, why, I'll be there too.

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: I don't understan' it, Tom.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Me neither.  It's jus' stuff I been thinkin' about. Gimme you han', Ma. Good-by.

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: Good-by, Tom. Later--when it's blowed over--you'll come back? You'll try to fin' us?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Sure. Good-by.

turns.speaker: MA
turns.text: Good-by, Tommy.

turns.speaker: MAE
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: PA
turns.text: Could you see your way clear to sell us a loaf of bread, ma'am.

turns.speaker: MAE
turns.text: This ain't a groc'ry store. We got bread to make san'widges with.

turns.speaker: PA
turns.text: I know, ma'am... on'y it's for a ole lady, no teeth, gotta sof'n it with water so she can chew it, an' she's hongry.

turns.speaker: MAE
turns.text: Whyn't you buy a san'wich? We got nice san'widges.

turns.speaker: PA
turns.text: I shore would like to do that, ma'am, but the fack is, we ain't got but a dime for it. It's all figgered out, I mean--for the trip.

turns.speaker: MAE
turns.text: You can't get no loaf a bread for a dime. We only got fifteen-cent loafs.

turns.speaker: MAE
turns.text: This here's a fifteen-cent loaf.

turns.speaker: PA
turns.text: Would you--could you see your way to cuttin' off ten cents worth?

turns.speaker: MAE
turns.text: You can have this for ten cents.

turns.speaker: PA
turns.text: I don't wanta rob you, ma'am.

turns.speaker: MAE
turns.text: Go ahead--Bert says take it.

turns.speaker: MAE
turns.text: Which ones?

turns.speaker: PA
turns.text: There, them stripy ones.

turns.speaker: MAE
turns.text: Oh, them? Well, no--them's *two* for a penny.

turns.speaker: PA
turns.text: Well, give me two then, ma'am.

turns.speaker: MULEY
turns.text: Tommy?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Muley! Where's my folks, Muley?

turns.speaker: MULEY
turns.text: They gone.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: I know that! But *where* they gone?

turns.speaker: MULEY
turns.text: Gone--  --over to your Uncle John's. The whole crowd of 'em, two weeks ago. But they can't stay there either, because John's got *his* notice to get off.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: But what's happened?  How come they got to get off? We been here fifty years--same place.

turns.speaker: MULEY
turns.text: Ever'body got to get off. Ever'body leavin', goin' to California. My folks, your folks, ever'body's folks.  Ever'body but me. I ain't gettin' off.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: But who done it?

turns.speaker: MULEY
turns.text: Listen!  That's some of what done it--the dusters. Started it, anyway. Blowin' like this, year after year--blowin' the land away, blowin' the crops away, blowin' us away now.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Are you crazy?

turns.speaker: MULEY
turns.text: Some say I am.  You want to hear what happened?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: That's what I asked you, ain't it?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Well?

turns.speaker: MULEY
turns.text: They come. They come and pushed me off.

turns.speaker: MULEY
turns.text: What was the use. He was right. There wasn't a thing in the world I could do about it.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: But it don't seem possible--kicked off like that!

turns.speaker: MULEY
turns.text: The rest of my fambly set out for the west--there wasn't nothin' to eat--but I couldn't leave. Somepin' wouldn't let me. So now I just wander around. Sleep wherever I am. I used to tell myself I was lookin' out for things, so when they come back ever'thing would be all right. But I knowed that wan't true. There ain't nothin' to look out for. And ain't nobody comin' back. They're gone-- and me, I'm just an 'ol graveyard ghost--that's all in the world I am.

turns.speaker: MULEY
turns.text: Listen!  That's them! Them lights! Come on, we got to hide out!

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Hide out for what? We ain't doin' nothin'.

turns.speaker: MULEY
turns.text: You're *trespassin'*! It ain't you lan' no more! An' that's the supr'tendant--with a gun!

turns.speaker: MULEY
turns.text: All you got to do is lay down an' watch.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Won't they come out here?

turns.speaker: MULEY
turns.text: I don't think so. One come out here once an' I clipped him from behin' with a fence stake. They ain't bothered since.

turns.speaker: THE MAN
turns.text: Fact of the matter, Muley, after what them dusters done to the land, the tenant system don't work no more. It don't even break even, much less show a profit. One man on a tractor can handle twelve or fourteen of these places. You just pay him a wage and take *all* the crop.

turns.speaker: MULEY
turns.text: But we couldn't *do* on any less'n what our share is now.  The chillun ain't gettin' enough to eat as it is, and they're so ragged we'd be shamed if ever'body else's chillun wasn't the same way.

turns.speaker: THE MAN
turns.text: I can't help that. All I know is I got my orders. They told me to tell you you got to get off, and that's what I'm telling you.

turns.speaker: MULEY
turns.text: You mean get off my own land?

turns.speaker: THE MAN
turns.text: Now don't go blaming me. It ain't *my* fault.

turns.speaker: MULEY
turns.text: Who's the Shawnee Land and Cattle Comp'ny?

turns.speaker: THE MAN
turns.text: It ain't nobody. It's a company.

turns.speaker: MULEY
turns.text: Then who *do* we shoot?

turns.speaker: THE MAN
turns.text: Brother, I don't know. If I did I'd tell you. But I just don't know *who's* to blame!

turns.speaker: MULEY
turns.text: Well, I'm right here to tell you, mister, ain't *nobody* going to push me off *my* land! Grampa took up this land seventy years ago. My pa was born here. We was *all* born on it, and some of us got killed on it, and some died on it. And that's what makes it ourn--bein' born on it, and workin' it, and dyin' on it--and not no piece of paper with writin' on it! So just come on and try to push me off!

turns.speaker: PA
turns.text: That's Connie Rivers with her. They're married now.  She's due about three-four months.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Why, she wasn't no more'n a kid when I went up.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: How you get all this money?

turns.speaker: PA
turns.text: Sol' things, chopped cotton--even Grampa. Got us about two hunnerd dollars all tol'. Shucked out seventy- five for this truck, but we still got nearly a hunnerd and fifty to set out on. I figger we oughta be able to make it on that.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Easy. After all, they ain't but about *twelve* of us, is they?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Either we got to tie him up and *throw* him on the truck, or somepin. He can't stay here.

turns.speaker: PA
turns.text: Can't tie him. Either we'll hurt him or he'll git so mad he'll hurt his self.  Reckon we could git him *drunk*?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Ain't no whisky, is they?

turns.speaker: PA
turns.text: Here we go!

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: California, here we come!

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: I figger best we leave something like this on him, lest somebody dig him up and make out he been kilt.  Lotta times looks like the gov'ment got more interest in a dead man than a live one.

turns.speaker: PA
turns.text: Not be so lonesome, either, knowin' his name is there with 'im, not just' a old fella lonesome underground.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Casy, won't you say a few words?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Got that desert yet. Gotta take her tonight. Take her in the daytime fella says she'll cut your gizzard out.

turns.speaker: PA
turns.text: How's Granma since we got her in the tent?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: She's jus' wore out, that's all.

turns.speaker: PA
turns.text: I shore would like to stop here a while an' give her some res' but we on'y got 'bout forty dollars left. I won't feel right till we're there an' all workin' an' a little money comin' in.

turns.speaker: PA
turns.text: Ya know, you're the second fella talked like that. I'd like to hear some more about that.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Me an' you both.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Just in case. Sit up back an' if anybody tries to climb up--let 'im have it.

turns.speaker: PA
turns.text: I ain't got nothin' in *my* han'.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Give 'im a fryin' pan.

turns.speaker: PA
turns.text: You wouldn't think jus' reachin' up an' pickin'd get you in the back.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Think I'll walk out an' try to fin' out what all that fuss outside the gate was. Anybody wanta come with me?

turns.speaker: PA
turns.text: No. I'm jus' gonna set awhile an' then go to bed.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: Take 'er on down, Al. I'll sign.

turns.speaker: PA
turns.text: We gonna stay, ain't we?

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: You're tootin' we're gonna stay.

turns.speaker: SECOND MAN
turns.text: Good wages, eh! Pickin' oranges an' peaches?

turns.speaker: PA
turns.text: We gonna take whatever they got.

turns.speaker: PA
turns.text: Whatta you think you're talkin' about? I got a han'bill here says good wages, an' I seen it in the papers they need pickers!

turns.speaker: SECOND MAN
turns.text: Awright, go on! Ain't nobody stoppin' ya!

turns.speaker: PA
turns.text: But what about this?

turns.speaker: SECOND MAN
turns.text: I ain't gonna fret you. Go on!

turns.speaker: PA
turns.text: But what does *that* prove?

turns.speaker: SECOND MAN
turns.text: Look at 'em! Same yella han'bill-- 800 pickers wanted. Awright, this man wants 800 men. So he prints up 5,000 a them han'bills an' maybe 20,000 people sees 'em. An' maybe two-three thousan' starts movin, wes' account a this han'bill. Two- three thousan' folks that's crazy with worry headin' out for 800 jobs! Does that make sense?

turns.speaker: ROSASHARN
turns.text: Heh'o Tom.  This is Connie, my husband.

turns.speaker: TOM
turns.text: If this don't beat all!  Well, I see you been busy already!

turns.speaker: ROSASHARN
turns.text: You do not see either!--not yet!
